page.title: 01Stockburn,a truly rural area
page.content: Facinating rural area, dominated by river Tees, three times. Through block. Land cover chiefly agricultural, strips of woodland. Twelve farmsteads, two small villages, Eryholme & Grisby. Other scattered houses make a sparcely populated area. Agriculture, mainly arable, winter wheat, Barley. Spring Barley, Oilsees Rape, Potatoes, Grass-Grazing, Silage, Hay. Arable grass in rotation. Dairy and beef cattle, and rearing. Lightest land near river. St Mary's Church, Eryholme. 1150. Late Normon early perpendicular style. Square tower, embattled parapet. More modern porch has built in pieces of 12th century detail and pieces of medieval coffin slabs. All Saints Church, Girsby. 1832 replaced former Stockburn church over river. Remains still in existence. Both churches
